intro: Cyrtandra aclada, commonly known as the Hawaiian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine pubescence. Cyrtandra aclada is an important component of Hawaii's endemic flora and is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of the archipelago.
